data.title: Favorite Italian Eatery
data.text: Love the bread plate they bring out. I've had a few of the shrimp dishes and they have been excellent. Nice pl,ace to take friends for a wonderful lunch.

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We hope to see you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Ummm
data.text: Our waiter was a dooosch floppin flip bag and flirted with my date. The pizza was okay but not authentic italian food

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We are sorry to hear you felt like our server flirted with your date. Without knowing any specifics, we can assure you this is something we do not tolerate. We are also sorry you did not enjoy the pizza as much as we would hope. Although the "authentic" classification of Italian food may be somewhat misinterpreted over the years, we can assure you we take every step towards making authentic Italian pizza. Features like our Italian imported wood burning oven, 48 hour dough, fresh local ingredients, and the usage of Fior di Latte mozzarella are all examples of steps we take to strive for an authentic Italian experience. We would encourage you to give us another try & thank you again for taking the time to review the restaurant.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Always Very Good
data.text: Always worth the stop. Service outstanding. Ambiance charming. Veggie pizza with kale (seasonal/local) is yummy. House wine of any color very good. Mangia salad fresh and balanced. Can dine from on a budget to expensive/ high end. Ingredients seasonal. Butternut squash ravioli etc were on the new menu. Mangia is a fantastic meeting place half way between Chicago and Milwaukee.

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you very much for taking the time to review the restaurant. We are glad to hear you enjoyed everything & thank you for the recommendation. We hope to see you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Hard to find better!
data.text:
There is nothing negative  about Mangia.
Food... Staff..... and dining experience is 5 plus stars.   Everything on the menu is wonderful.    The tiramisu is heaven sent.

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for writing your review. We are glad that you enjoy everything and we look forward to the next time you decide to stop in.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Unexpectedly good
data.text: We stopped for brunch & not because the sign outside claimed the best brunch in Kenosha. Service was good, we were told they get busy with the after church crowd, FYI only. The food was fantastic. Likely the best eggs benedict I have ever had. Each of us had something different & I would have enjoyed them all. Illy coffee, need I say more? Good weather allowed for a nice al fresco experience. We will be back.

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We are really happy to hear that you enjoyed everything and we look forward to the next time you are able to stop in.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good service, foul food
data.text:
I wish I were writing this review far in the future so that the experience wouldn't be so fresh in my memory. Alas, I am writing this review about one hour after leaving Mangia. My wife and I ordered the Calamari, the Gnocchi and the Sea Scallops.

Calamari is our benchmark dish in any restaurant that offers it. We've had it, and loved it, all over the world. The odor of spoiled fish preceded the arrival of the dish. I thought, no way, nobody would serve that. It can't be our food. In the 1930's there was an expression "You stink on ice." The meaning is that the person's odor was so offensive that even attempting to keep the item fresh on ice could not mask the odor. This Calamari was that bad. It was "find the spot in the harbor that has no flow at all and collects all the garbage" bad.

One bite was all we needed. It didn't even stay on the table long enough to take a picture of it. 

The manager was quite accommodating and professional. She stated however, that she had checked in the calamari herself just that morning. There is no question, this squid was spoiled. Let's assume the manager did check the items in this morning. I can only assume that the squid was left in the August heat and spoiled after it arrives at Mangia. 

This item did not appear on our bill.

My $39 Sea Scallops arrived. Picture attached. When the dish came before me I smelled the spoiled Calami. I suspect they were on the same grill and the scallops picked up some of the contamination. The smell and taste of spoilage was present but much diminished. 

The scallops were not seared, but burned. The flavor of the ruined exterior likewise ruined the flavor of the scallops. The exterior completed dominated the flavor. One small sliver for me. One small sliver for my wife. The dish went back.

The manager offered me anything else on the menu. I declined. I decided it was safer to skip dinner than to try another dish at Mangia.

My wife's $18 Gnocchi was a surprisingly small serving. French restaurant small. She did not enjoy it, but she did eat it.

The manager removed the scallops from the bill and also, generously removed the gnocchi from the bill as well. We paid only for a beer and soda.

Despite the awful experience with the food we left a nearly 100 percent tip as the service was excellent.

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to write your review. We value all of our guests opinions greatly. All reviews allow us to gain feedback and pay a closer attention to detail every day. While we are happy to hear you were pleased with the service, we are disappointed to hear you did not enjoy your food. We are incredibly sorry you did not enjoy your experience. We can assure you that we take steps every single day to ensure that we are serving the freshest ingredients. I would encourage you to give us another try and to contact us directly at the restaurant. Thank you so much for taking the time out of your day to write your review. We really appreciate it.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: good food good service
data.text: We had a group of 5 for dinner on a Saturday night.  The wine was good, food was good, good selection of specials and service was good.  Would return again next time we are in Kenosha.

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the review. We are glad you enjoyed everything! Hopefully you come to Kenosha again soon and see us!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Food and Exceptional Service
data.text:
One of Chef James "specials" was greatly enjoyed by my husband partly due to our server, Adam, who gave us a detailed description of the Sablefish and it's preparation.  Adam delivered exceptional service with attention to details and always with a smile and friendly attitude - this young man enjoys his job!  Because of these outstanding dishes, mine being the Chicken Breast, amazing prep on this - never thought it could taste that great, we will be back to savor many more dinners here executed by Chef James along with the wood-burning oven pizzas and pasta dishes which are original Mangia menu items.

Mangia's seating includes a cozy bar room that is a comfortable pub-like setting and then there are two other adjacent rooms   The not-to-be-missed beautiful outdoor patio is wonderful for dining or enjoying drinks!

Parking is in a nearby lot.

Note: Sablefish was $40/well 39 to be exact, I was surprised by this and sure glad hubby enjoyed it! Indicating prices on the "Specials" may be appreciated by some.

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your review! We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed the food, service, and ambiance. You make a fantastic point regarding the price of the specials and I will be sure to go over this with our entire staff. Once again, thank you very much for taking the time to review the restaurant and we hope to see you in again very soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: We are coming back!
data.text: What a gem!  While visiting relatives in Kenosha, we ate brunch twice at this delightful restaurant.  Our group had the lemon poppy seed pancakes, the frittata, eggs benedict with Paielli's focaccia (gotta have this bread when you're in town) and the coffee rubbed steak and eggs.  All of us raved about what we ate.  Husband and I had the eggs benedict and we also shared the grilled romaine caesar salad.  Grilling the romaine gives it a new flavor and the dressing was yummy.  Ten thumbs up on the eggs benedict.  Husband and I went back the following Sunday and had the coffee rubbed steak and eggs (poached).  Wow - loved it.  Only regret is that we didn't make it back for dinner.  Thank God we visit Kenosha frequently because we will definitely make it for dinner.  Great food, great service and delightful ambiance.  I recommend you go for it!

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you very much for taking the time to review the restaurant. We are happy that you have enjoyed the Brunch. We hope to see you again very soon for Dinner. Thanks again for the recommendation!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Yum
data.text: Always interesting food. Mangia works hard to create dishes that are both creative and familiar - so there can be a huge comfort food factor while at the same time your tongue will be tickled!

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We are glad you have enjoyed your experiences and hope to see you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wonderful Dinner!
data.text: Our family has been coming to Mangia for 20 years. We've always loved the rigatoni Della nonna and roasted salmon. When the restaurant underwent a renovation of both menu and decor, it took a while to get used to the changes but I'm happy that our dinner last Friday night was outstanding in every way. I had the tagliatelle which was simply some of the best pasta I've ever had anywhere. One daughter had the gnocchi and the othe the spaghetti vongole. Both were delicious. My husband had the steak cacciatore which he greatly enjoyed. Desserts were also on point. We had a particularly nice bottle of Pinot Grigio from Trentino and because we were having such a nice evening and didn't want it to end, ordered limoncello. Service is always friendly and efficient and the owner never fails to great us warmly. Highly recommended!

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are extremely pleased that you enjoyed your experience. Thank you so much for taking the time to write your review. We hope to see you in the restaurant again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Solid fresh Italian fare
data.text:
My husband and I got to Mangia's for special occasions. While the dishes are a bit pricey, I understand this is reflected in ingredient quality and time to prep. I love all the fresh vegetables used and that the menu invariably always echoes the season. Our last visit I had the Scallops and Polenta with Arugula and my husband ordered the Gnocchi. We also shared the Calamari w/ ink to get us started. 
When we come we always splurge on drinks...wine, beer, martinis. Of course it IS a special occasion!
This last trip my husband wanted to cap off his meal with a cappuccino. The staff was managing a large party and after 10 minutes after ordering and not receiving, we decided to take it off the check and head out.
All and all our experiences have been very good. The food and atmosphere is excellent. We will be back.

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. I apologize that you were not able to receive your cappuccino. That is unacceptable and will be addressed. I would ask that you ask for me upon your next visit. I am pleased to hear that you love our fresh ingredients and seasonal menus along with the atmosphere. We are also very pleased to hear you will be back and we look forward to seeing you again. Thank you so much for reviewing the restaurant.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Will NOT be back!!
data.text: The first time we went was V-Day, maybe 3 years ago, did not make a reservation, so there was no space. (Ok, I get that...) We went for Easter this meal, made a reservation online - got there, they didn't have the reservation.... we were offered to sit in the lounge. If this is the kind of setting we wanted, we wouldn't have made a reservation! So, sorry for this business....you won't ever get my business or recommendation!!!!!

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to review the restaurant. We are extremely disappointed to hear you will not be returning or recommending us. Upon arrival you stated that you had a reservation for 3 at 10:45 on Easter Sunday. You stated the reservation was made online. We looked for the reservation under the name you provided but were unable to find a reservation with the provided name. We asked to see a confirmation but you were unable to provide us with that information. Being one of our busiest days of the year we stated that we could seat you immediately in the lounge as we were fully booked in our dining room. You denied this request. After this occurred, our owner stated, "Just give us a minute please and we will work something out for you." As we tried to figure something out you refused to wait and your party decided to leave ignoring our persistence that we would work this out for you. We are incredibly sorry that you were frustrated by this situation but we were trying as hard as we possibly could to work something out for you. The following week (April 3rd) we noticed that we had a reservation for Brunch at the same time, same guest count, under the same name you provided us. It looks like this may have been an error made by whoever made the reservation online from your party. Had you presented us with a confirmation number we would have been able to detect this error right away. We understand that this was a frustrating situation for you and your party but we would love to have you back in the restaurant and would treat you with respect and hospitality. We hope that you decide to change your mind and give us a try again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wonderful restaurant
data.text: My ex-son in law used to be the cook.  Excellent Italian food.  This is where you go when on a special occasion.

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review! We hope to see you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Southern italy
data.text: The new chef is doing a nice job. Thr grilled Ceasar salad was good, but the star of our meal was the scallop dish. They were prepared perfectly.  The brussel sprouts were made well, but could have used a bit more salt. What I like most about Mangia is the restaurant feel and people.

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your experience! We look forward to seeing you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Quick dinner out
data.text: Kenosha is very thin on fine dining options, Mangia is among 4 or 5 that would somewhat qualify.  Manga is one of several Famaglia Mantuano locations.  The Antipasto appetizer and Salsicca Pizza were our choices for a quick dinner complemented by a bottle of Benuara Nero d'avila.  Service and atmosphere are pleasant, prices and food quality are consistent with this small town location and it's clientele.  The Chicago locations run by these owners are far superior.  Not too bad considering the limited choices in Kenosha.

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review of the restaurant. We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your experience and we look forward to the next time you decide to stop in.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Happy Hour Fun
data.text: We have been a customer of Mangia Wine Bar for 15 years and I have to say the menu and meals are the best ever.  The pizzas are creative and wood fired.  The crust is chewy and delicious.  Try the pork shank or any of the seasonal specials.  There are great prices for happy hour.  The staff are so welcoming and friendly.

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to review the restaurant. We'd also like to thank you for being a dedicated customer for 15 years, this encourages us every day! We look forward to seeing you again for dinner & happy hour!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great but not consistent.
data.text: Delicious. Have had amazing meals here. By far my mom's favorite restaurant.  I've had a few experiences that were less than fabulous - the pea salad that I had last year was bad - they were still on the vine and it was almost inedible.  My sister had the same salad a week before and she loved it.  I think mine was prepared incorrectly. Will return soon because I know they are great. Will update review then.

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review. We apologized that you have had inconsistent experiences in the past. We work hard to maintain a consistent environment with quality production. We are glad to hear you will return soon and we look forward to seeing you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great for Dinner & Happy Hour
data.text: If you're looking for a great deal on artisanal pizza, cocktails & craft beer, come for Happy Hour. If a reasonably priced dinner with a menu created by a James Beard award winning, celebrity chef, come for dinner. Taylor & his team execute Tony's vision flawlessly. Finally, check out the web site & attend a cooking demo, wine class or other special event hosted by the Mantuano family. Whichever you choose, you will not be disappointed.

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your extremely kind words & taking the time to write your review. We are glad you had a great experience. Maybe we will see you at a class in the future! Until then, best wishes.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: New Year's Eve Dinner
data.text: My husband and I had dinner at Mangia's New Year's eve last year.  Had a wonderful dinner and nice background music.  Would definitely visit this restaurant again.

owner_response.author: Tre M, General Manager at Mangia Wine Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review. We look forward to seeing you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
